title: NBC Olympic Font
content:
Can't find an image anywhere, so you'll have to watch the Olympics on NBC tonight. ;)   
   
I'm trying to identify the transitional font used in their splashes and graphics mattes. I believe they also use it during Bob Costas' commentating for the on-screen graphics.   
   
My initial impression is Officina Serif, but I'm sure you guys can nail it exactly.
author: sperte

comments.content:
Second guess: [Jones?](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017011411/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/jones/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=OLYMPIC+SPIRIT)   
   
Sorry about the low-quality pics. I had to freeze a frame on my tv and take a digital shot.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017011411im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47467.jpg) ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017011411im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47468.jpg)

It's not Officina, but that's all I know.   
   
(edit) yes Jones looks right but either there's a bolder version or they bolded it by hand.
